Rule.Name: TestFixture should be declared public
Rule.Description: A non-public class is marked as a test fixture. This test fixture will not be executed by NUnit.
Rule.Resolution: Declare '{0}' as public or remove the [TestFixture] attribute.

Rule.Name: TestFixture should not be abstract
Rule.Description: Test fixture classes should not be abstract. Move the [TestFixture] attribute to the concrete class.
Rule.Resolution: Test fixture '{0}' is abstract, move the [TestFixture] attribute to the concrete class.

Rule.Name: TestFixture should be sealed
Rule.Description: Test fixture classes should be sealed, base classes should not be test fixtures.
Rule.Resolution: Test fixture '{0}' is not sealed, mark it as sealed.

Rule.Name: TestFixture should have a single setup method
Rule.Description: Test fixture classes should have 0 to 1 setup methods.
Rule.Resolution: Test fixture '{0}' has more than one setup method, mark only one as a setup method.

Rule.Name: TestFixture should have a single tear down method
Rule.Description: Test fixture classes should have 0 to 1 tear down methods.
Rule.Resolution: Test fixture '{0}' has more than one tear down method, mark only one as a tear down method.

Rule.Name: Test cases should be marked with TestAttribute
Rule.Description: NUnit detects test case as methods that are marked with TestAttribute or methods that start with "test" (case insensitive). The recommended approach is to use TestAttribute rather than the name prefix which is supported for backward compatability.
Rule.Resolution: Test case '{0}' is not marked with the TestAttribute, mark it with the TestAttribute or rename it so that it doesn't start with "test".

Rule.Name: Test fixture public method should be marked
Rule.Description: Test fixtures public methods should be marked as setup, tear down, or test case.
Rule.Resolution: Public method '{0}' is not marked as setup, tear down, or test case. Mark it as an NUnit method or make it non-public.

Rule.Name: Attribute should only mark test fixtures
Rule.Description: An NUnit attribute is used to mark a class which is not a TestFixture.
Rule.Resolution: Mark class '{0}' with [TestFixture] or remove other NUnit attributes marking this class.

Rule.Name: Attribute should only mark test cases
Rule.Description: An NUnit attribute is used to mark a method which is not a test case.
Rule.Resolution: Mark method '{0}' with [Test] or remove other NUnit attributes marking this method.

Rule.Name: Category name should be specified
Rule.Description: A category attribute is used with its name set to a blank string.
Rule.Resolution: Set category name in CategoryAttribute associated with test fixture '{0}'.
Set category name in CategoryAttribute associated with test case '{1}' in test fixture '{0}'.

Rule.Name: Ignore reason should be specified
Rule.Description: An ignore attribute is used with its name set to a blank string.
Rule.Resolution: Set ignore reason in IgnoreAttribute associated with test fixture '{0}'.
Set ignore reason in IgnoreAttribute associated with test case '{1}' in test fixture '{0}'.

Rule.Name: TestFixture should not have public properties
Rule.Description: A test fixture should not have public properties whether inherited or declared within the type. This includes both static and instance properties.
Rule.Resolution: Mark property '{0}.{1}' as protected or private.

Rule.Name: TestFixture constructor should be public.
Rule.Description: A test fixture should not have a non-public constructor.
